name: The Weeping Coast
description:
A desolate, fog-shrouded coastline dominated by a tall, silent lighthouse. The air is thick with the smell of salt and sorrow. Locals speak of a ghostly light and a wailing sound that carries on the wind at night.

Engage Region Action

You decide to investigate the strange occurrences. Draw the next card from this Region Deck: 'The Ghost of the Lighthouse'.

name: The Ghost of the Lighthouse
description:
The source of the wailing seems to be the old lighthouse that stands on a rocky outcrop just off the coast. You must make your way to its base to investigate further.

Objective

Travel to the lighthouse.

Journey

Make a Journey Roll to cross the treacherous, tide-swept causeway. Your destination is the 'Lighthouse Shore' Location Card.

Progression

Upon arriving, begin a Timed Scene using the 'Lighthouse Shore' card for setup.

name: Lighthouse Shore
description:
You arrive on the rocky island. The base of the lighthouse looms above. The skeletal remains of drowned sailors, animated by a restless spirit, claw their way from the surf!

Setup

  • Map: 10x10 grid.
  • Enemies: Place 3 'Skeletal Pirate' creatures at A5, B4, and B6.
  • Players: Start on any square in column J.

Objective

Defeat all enemies.

Progression

Once all enemies are defeated, draw the next card from this Region Deck: 'Climbing the Spire'.

name: Skeletal Pirate
description:
A reanimated skeleton in tattered pirate garb, wielding a rusty cutlass.

Rusted Cutlass(Active) Melee attack that deals HD damage.
Undying(Passive) When this creature is defeated, roll a d6. On a 6, it reassembles at the start of its next turn with 1 HP.

name: Climbing the Spire
description:
The entrance to the lighthouse is a heavy, iron door, rusted shut by decades of salt spray. The wailing from within grows louder.

Objective

Find a way inside the lighthouse.

Progression

Begin a Timed Scene. Use the 'Lighthouse Entrance' Location Card for setup.

name: Lighthouse Entrance
description:
A small, 10x5 landing at the base of the lighthouse. The only feature is a massive, rusted iron door (üîç at A3). There are no enemies here.

Investigate the Door

A character adjacent to the door can use their Action to attempt to open it. Choose one of the following actions:

  • Force the Door (Hack & Slash): Make a Hack & Slash attack against the door (HP: 20, Armor: 3).
  • Pick the Lock (Disarm): Attempt to pick the lock. Roll+DEX. On a 16+, the door opens silently. On a 9-15, it opens with a loud groan, and the party is Weakened for the first round of the next combat. On a 1-8, your tools break.

Progression

Once the door is open, discard this card and draw the next card: 'The Lantern Room'.

name: The Lantern Room
description:
You ascend the winding stairs to the top of the lighthouse. In the center of the room, a spectral figure weeps over the unlit lantern. It is the ghost of the lighthouse keeper, Captain Eva. She turns, her face a mask of sorrow and rage. "You will not extinguish my memory!"

Objective

Confront the spirit of the Weeping Captain.

Progression

Begin a Timed Scene. Use the 'Lantern Room' Location Card for setup.

name: Lantern Room
description:
The circular 8x8 room at the peak of the lighthouse. A massive, unlit crystal lantern (üîç) dominates the center four squares (D4, E4, D5, E5).

Setup

  • Enemies: Place the 'Weeping Captain' at E4.
  • Players: Start on any square in row 8.

Light the Lantern

An adjacent character can use their action to try and relight the lantern. Roll+WIS. On a 16+, the lantern flares to life, making the Captain Stunned for 1 round. On a 9-15, it sputters, making the Captain Weakened for 1 round. On a 1-8, it fails.

Progression

When the 'Weeping Captain' is defeated, draw the final card: 'Peace for the Captain'.

name: The Weeping Captain
description:
The sorrowful spirit of a lighthouse keeper, bound to her post and enraged by her fading memory.

Sorrowful Wail(Active) All characters must Defy Danger (WIS). On a 1-8, you take 1d6 SD and are Frightened for 1 round. On a 9-15, you take 1d4 SD.
Incorporeal(Passive) Takes half damage from non-magical physical sources (HD).

name: Peace for the Captain
description:
With the spirit defeated, a sense of peace settles over the lighthouse. The lantern, now lit, casts a warm, steady glow across the sea. You have put the captain's spirit to rest.

Reward

The party receives 100 gold each. You find the 'Captain's Spyglass' rare item resting on the railing.

Progression

You have completed this region's story. If this Region Deck had a Key Token on it, you now claim it. Discard all remaining cards in this deck. You may now travel or engage another region.

name: Captain's Spyglass
description:
An ornate brass spyglass that feels strangely cold. Looking through it, you can see not just ships, but the ghostly echoes of where they have been.

Ghostly Wake

When you use the Explore New Region action in a Campaign, you may look through the spyglass. If you do, you have advantage on the Journey Roll to travel to that region for the first time.
